'''Television in Switzerland''' was [[Timeline of the introduction of television in countries|introduced in 1950]]. People who live in [[Switzerland]] and receive television services are required by law to pay a [[television licence]] fee, which is used to finance the public radio and television service [[SRG SSR]]. [[Licence fee]]-payers in all the [[Linguistic geography of Switzerland|linguistic regions of Switzerland]] all pay the same amount (462 [[Swiss franc|CHF]] for 2008, counting both radio and television licences)<ref>[http://www.bakom.ch/themen/radio_tv/00630/01618/01667/index.html?lang=it UFCOM, Reception fees]</ref> and, in return, are entitled under the law to services of equal quality.
== History == The history of television in Switzerland began in 1939 when the first test transmissions commenced. Regular transmissions started in [[1953 in television|1953]], at first only one hour a day for five days a week, and only in [[German language|German]]: transmissions in [[French language|French]] started in 1954 and in [[Italian language|Italian]] only in 1958.
[[Romansh language|Romansh]]-speaking Swiss had to wait until 1963 for the first programme in their language, a full decade after regular television transmission were initiated. To this day, there is no dedicated Romansh-language channel; instead the German and Italian channels air a few hours of Romansh programming per day. The 1960s also saw the arrival of [[television advertising]], in 1964, and of [[colour television]], in 1968.
[[Télévision suisse romande]] broadcast their first evening programme in [[colour television|colour]] in 1968.<ref name=Allez>{{fr}} Sonia Arnal, [http://www3.unil.ch/wpmu/allezsavoir/cest-l%E2%80%99autre-la-vraie-revolution-de-1968-la-tv-couleur-debarque-en-suisse/ "C'est l'autre (la vraie ?) révolution de 1968 : la TV couleur débarque en Suisse"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012041941/http://www3.unil.ch/wpmu/allezsavoir/cest-l%E2%80%99autre-la-vraie-revolution-de-1968-la-tv-couleur-debarque-en-suisse/ |date=12 October 2013 }}, ''[[Allez savoir !]]'', no. 42, September 2008.</ref> 1968 was also the first year where more than one million Swiss households had a television.<ref name=Allez/>
In 1984, the Swiss [[teletext]] service, [[SwissTXT]], was started. In 1993 a fourth [[SRG SSR]] channel was created, first named "S Plus" but later renamed [[Schweiz 4]] (Switzerland 4). However, this was short-lived: during its existence the channel constantly suffered low ratings and was hence shut down in 1997. In the same year, as a result, all the [[SRG SSR]] subsidiaries started a second channel, and [[SRF zwei]], [[RTS Deux]] and [[RSI La 2]] came into existence.
Analogue television was phased out starting July [[2006 in television|2006]], when [[Televisione svizzera di lingua italiana|TSI]] (now [[Radiotelevisione svizzera di lingua italiana|RSI]]) began the analogue switchoff. The process continued until January [[2008 in television|2008]], when the end of analogue broadcasting in [[Valais]] and [[Chablais]] completed the [[digital television transition]] in Switzerland.<ref>[http://www.broadbandtvnews.com/?p=3768 Switzerland completes analogue switch-over]</ref>
In September 2018, SRG SSR announced that it would discontinue over-the-air broadcasting in [[DVB-T]] in 2019, citing costs, rather than implement [[DVB-T2]]. The services will remain available via encrypted free-to-air satellite, which offers all SRG SSR channels in [[high-definition television|high definition]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.broadbandtvnews.com/2018/09/06/switzerland-to-end-terrestrial-television/|title=Switzerland to end terrestrial television|date=2018-09-05|work=Broadband TV News|access-date=2018-09-12|language=en-GB}}</ref>
== List of channels == The following is a list of [[television channel]]s broadcast in Switzerland:
=== German-speaking Switzerland === * [[SRF 1]]: the first of the three national German-language channels in Switzerland (the others being [[SRF zwei]] and [[SRF info]]). Run under the public [[SRG SSR]] broadcasting group. SRF 1 is considered to be the channel that airs more local programming, infotainment and other programmes of that nature. * [[SRF zwei]]: Channel programming consists of sports, youth programmes, movies and a wide range of American prime time shows. * [[SRF info]]: news channel owned by the public broadcasting group. * [[3 (Switzerland)|3]]: simulcast in [[German language|German]] and [[French language|French]] for the channel's target audience includes those in the 16–34-year-old age group, cooperation with [[Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen|SRF]] and [[Radio Télévision Suisse|RTS]] (soon) * [[3sat]]: public, advertising-free, television network run jointly by the public broadcasters of Germany, Austria and Switzerland. It is available off the ASTRA satellite to all of Europe and North Africa and West Asia. * [[CHTV]]: Culture Channel serving as platform for creative people launched in 2013. Programming consists mainly of culture magazines, entertaining documentaries and movies. * [[3+ (Switzerland)|3+]]: Swiss general programming channel launched in 2006. Programming consists mainly of reality shows, infotainment and American fiction. * [[4+ (Switzerland)|4+]]: Swiss channel broadcasting since 2012. * [[5+ (Switzerland)|5+]]: Swiss channel broadcasting since 2014. * [[TeleZüri]]: originally a local station in the city of [[Zurich]], the channel now is available throughout the German-speaking part of the country. It airs the most viewed nightly newscast of all commercial channels in Switzerland. * [[Sat.1 Schweiz]]: Swiss version of [[Sat.1]]. It differs from the latter in some local programming and regionalised advertising. * [[ProSieben Schweiz]]: Swiss version of [[ProSieben]]. It differs from the latter in some local programming and regionalised advertising. * [[S1 (Switzerland)|S1 TV]]: Swiss channel geared towards an older audience launched in 2013. Programming consists mainly of documentaries and television drama. * [[Star TV (Switzerland)|Star TV]]: cinema and lifestyle channel, with moviews and programs about upcoming movies in theaters and in the home market, musical programs (mainly videoclips) and programs about videogames. * [[joiz]]: youth-oriented channel, broadcasting magazines, music videos and live call-in shows, where viewers can participate mostly by means of social media. * [[Viva Schweiz]]: Swiss version of [[Viva (TV station)|Viva]]. * [[Nickelodeon (Switzerland)|Nickelodeon Schweiz]]: Swiss version of [[Nickelodeon]]. * [[Comedy Central Schweiz]]: Swiss version of [[Comedy Central]]. * [[Energy TV]]: music station, broadcasting back-to-back music videos. * [[Sport Szene Fernsehen]]: sports channel, focusing on less popular sports. * [[Schweiz 5]]: transmitted by cable, its programming is mostly made of call-in shows and infomercials. * [[Teleclub]]: pay-TV company, operating several movie channels and a wide offer of live sports from Switzerland and abroad. :''German channels available in Switzerland with local advertising:'' [[RTL Television|RTL]], [[RTL II]], [[Super RTL]], [[VOX (TV channel)|Vox]], [[Kabel 1]], [[Sixx (TV channel)|Sixx]] :''Unlocalised German and Austrian channels available in Switzerland:'' all public and most commercial channels from the neighbouring countries are widely available in Switzerland through cable TV.
===French-speaking Switzerland === * [[RTS Un]]: the first Swiss French language public television channel. Run under the public SRG SSR broadcasting group. RTS Un runs a general schedule with a focus on news and local programming. * [[RTS Deux]]: The channel's programming is composed of [[reruns]] from the [[RTS Un]] television archive, children's television programs in the morning and early afternoon, teens programs in the late afternoon and evening and cultural programs or sports transmissions during prime time. * [[RTS Info]]: virtual television channel, owned by Télévision Suisse Romande, and launched on 26 December 2006. It broadcasts 24 hours a day using an internet stream, and many times (especially in the night and the early morning) simulcasts on RTS Deux. * [[Rouge TV]]: private musical channel, primarily aimed at the 15-34 demographics. * [[TVM3 Switzerland|TVM3]]: first private channel allowed to broadcast in the whole [[Romandy]] after the shutdown of Télécinéromandie. It began transmission on 1 May 2004. * [[TV5MONDE]]: global [[television]] network, broadcasting several channels of [[French language|French-language]] programming. * TF1 Suisse: Swiss version of [[TF1]]. It differs from the latter only in the regionalised advertising. * M6 Suisse: Swiss version of [[Métropole 6]]. It differs from the latter only in the regionalised advertising. * W9 Suisse: Swiss version of [[W9 (TV channel)|W9]]. It differs from the latter only in the regionalised advertising. :''Unlocalised French channels available in Switzerland:'' all public and most commercial channels from the neighbouring countries are widely available in Switzerland through cable TV.
=== Italian-speaking Switzerland === * [[RSI La 1]]: general television channel, broadcasting in Italian for the Italian-speaking Swiss in the whole country. Run under the public SRG SSR broadcasting group. Its programming is made of game shows, news programmes, movies, documentaries and less frequently sports programmes. * [[RSI La 2]]: Sister channel of [[RSI La 1]], broadcast in Italian. It mainly transmits sport programs, but also [[reruns]] and music programs. It does not broadcast any newscast. * [[TeleTicino]]: commercial television channel focusing on news from the Italian-speaking part of the country. :''Unlocalised Italian channels available in Switzerland:'' all public and most commercial channels from the neighbouring countries are widely available in Switzerland through cable TV.
=== Romansch-speaking Switzerland === There is not a television channel broadcasting exclusively in [[Romansh language]]; instead, [[Radio Television Rumantscha]]'s productions are transmitted on [[SRF 1]], [[RSI La 2]] and [[SRF info]] a few minutes a day. Programming includes [[Telesguard]] (a [[newscast]]), [[Cuntrasts]] and [[l'Istorgia da buna notg]] (bedtime story).
== Regional channels == Local radio and television networks in Switzerland are entitled to 4% of the licence fee every year (about 50,000,000 [[Swiss franc|CHF]] for 2007). The number of subsidised television broadcasters is limited to 13, one for each designated coverage area. Also, the support share cannot exceed 50% of the operating costs of each network.{{ref|2}} * [[TeleBärn]]: local television channel in German for the capital city of [[Berne]] and its surroundings. * [[Telebasel]]: local television channel in German for the city of [[Basel]]. * [[Tele M1]]: local television channel in German for the Mittelland region. * [[TeleBielingue]]: [[simulcast]] in German and French for the city of [[Biel/Bienne]]. * [[Tele 1]]: local television channel in German for the area of [[Lucerne]]. * [[Tele Top]]: local television channel in German for the area of [[Winterthur]]. * [[TV Ostschweiz|TVO]]: local television channel in German for the eastern part of Switzerland. * [[Tele Südostschweiz]]: local television channel in German for the canton of [[Graubünden]]. * [[Schaffhauser Fernsehen SHF]]: local television channel in German for the city of [[Schaffhausen]]. * [[ZüriPlus]]: local television channel in German for the city of [[Zurich]], an alternative to [[TeleZüri]]. * Canal 9: local television channel in French for the canton of [[Valais]]. * [[Canal Alpha]]: local television channel in French for the cantons of [[Neuchâtel]] and [[Canton of Jura|Jura]]. * [[Léman Bleu]]: local television channel in French for the city of [[Geneva]]. * [[La Télé]]: local television channel in French for the cantons of [[Vaud]] and [[Fribourg]].
== Cable television == A vast majority of the country is covered by [[cable network]]s; the major [[cable television]] operators is [[upc cablecom]].
In 2007, the [[Federal Office of Communications]] (OFCOM) applied a [[must-carry]] regulation, requiring the local cable companies to transmit all the [[SRG SSR]] network stations and the following foreign channels: [[arte]], [[3sat]], [[Euronews]], [[TV5MONDE]], [[ARD (broadcaster)|ARD]], [[ORF eins]], [[France 2]], [[Rai Uno]].<ref>[http://www.admin.ch/ch/i/rs/784_401/app3.html Elenco dei programmi esteri che devono essere diffusi su linea in tutta la Svizzera] {{it}}</ref>
==International channels==
All public and most commercial channels from the neighbouring countries are widely available in Switzerland through digital television services.
== Notes and references== {{Reflist|2}}

{{unreferenced|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox television | show_name = The All Star Talent Show | image = The All Star Talent Show Logo.jpg | caption = | camera = | picture_format = [[16:9]] | runtime = 90 mins | creator = | developer = | executive_producer = | starring = [[Andi Peters]]
[[Myleene Klass]]
[[Julian Clary]] | narrated = | opentheme = | endtheme = | language = English | country = United Kingdom | network = [[Channel 5 (UK)|Five]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2006|09|08|df=y}} | last_aired = {{End date|2006|10|13|df=y}} | num_series = 1 | num_episodes = 6 | website = }} '''''The All Star Talent Show''''' was a 2006 UK television programme that was broadcast on [[Channel 5 (UK)|Five]]. It was presented by [[Andi Peters]] and [[Myleene Klass]], with [[Julian Clary]] making up the judging panel alongside two guest judges. Each show had six celebrities performing, with the winner of each episode going into the final at the end of the series. In addition, the runner up with the most votes at the end of the series also performed again in the final. ==Episodes== ===Week 1 (8 September) === {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border=1 ! class="unsortable"|Celebrity !! class="unsortable"|Talent !! page.title: The Cat in the Hat Comes Back

revision.text:
{{No footnotes|date=February 2017}}
{{Infobox book | name = The Cat in the Hat Comes Back | image = The Cat in the Hat Comes Back Cover.jpg | caption = | author = [[Dr. Seuss]] | country = United States | language = English | genre = [[Children's literature]] | publisher = [[Random House]] | pub_date = January 1, 1958 | media_type = Print ([[Hardcover]] and [[paperback]]) | pages = | isbn = | oclc = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Cat in the Hat Comes Back''''' is a children's book written and illustrated by [[Dr. Seuss]] and published by [[Random House]] in 1958. The book is a sequel to ''[[The Cat in the Hat]]''.
== Plot == Once again, Sally and her brother are being left home alone for the day, but this time, their mother has left them with instructions to clear away a large amount of snow while she is out for the day. However, they are soon interrupted in their work by the arrival of the Cat in the Hat. Sally warns her brother not to talk to the Cat, because, he plays lots of bad tricks. Telling him not to let him come near. As they "remember what he did the last time he was there."
But the Cat lets himself into their house to get out of the snow, and when the brother follows him in, he finds the Cat eating a cake in the tub with the hot and cold water on. He glares at the Cat, turns off the water, and drains the tub only to find that a long pink ring has formed around the sides of the bath tub. The Cat offers to help, but his preliminary attempts to remove the pink spot fail as he only transfers the mess to a succession of other objects: their mother's white dress, the wall, their father's pair of $10 shoes, a rug, and their father's bed. Unsure of how to remove the stain from the bed, the Cat calls on the help of Little Cat A, who lives inside his hat, who lifts his hat to reveal Little Cat B, and then Little Cat C. The three Little Cats go to work, sending the stain to the television, then a pan, and finally outside.
Seeing the spot cover the snow, Little Cat C lifts his hat to reveal Little Cats D through G. The seven Little Cats wage war on the snow spots, shooting at pink snowballs with pop guns. This only spreads the spots more, so Little Cat G lifts his hat to reveal Little Cats H through V. All the cats work more, but the spot keeps spreading, until all the snow is pink, so Little Cat V takes off his hat to uncover Little Cats W, X, Y and the microscopic Little Cat Z. Z takes his hat off and unleashes a "Voom", which cleans up the spot, clears all the snow from the paths, and puts all of the Little Cats back into the Cat's hat. The Cat leaves, with the promise that he and the Little Cats, from A through Z, will return someday.
The book ends in a burst of flamboyant versification, with the full list of little cats arranged into a metrically perfect rhymed [[quatrain]], designed to teach the reader the alphabet.
==Adaptations==
After the [[The Cat in the Hat (film)|2003 film adaption of the original story]], it was planned to make a sequel based on ''The Cat in the Hat Comes Back''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,490238,00.html | title=The Deal Report | publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]] | date=October 3, 2003 | accessdate=March 5, 2018 | author=Kirschilling, Gregory}}</ref> However due to negative reception, Theodore Geisel's widow, Audrey Geisel, decided to not allow any future live-action adaptions of her husband's works and the plans for the sequel were cancelled.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/4362025|title=Seussentenial: 100 years of Dr. Seuss|work=MSNBC|date=February 26, 2004|access-date=March 5, 2018|quote="Geisel says she will never again allow Hollywood to portray Seuss characters in live action."}}</ref>
===VHS/DVD===
The book has included other stories, [[Fox in Socks]] & [[There's a Wocket in My Pocket]].

Merantau Films }} | distributor = {{Plainlist| * [[Sony Pictures Classics]] * Stage 6 Films * (United States) }} | released = {{Film date|df=yes|2014|01|21|[[2014 Sundance Film Festival|Sundance]]|2014|03|28|United States}}<!--- Per [[WP:FILMRELEASE]] ---> | runtime = 150 minutes<!--- Theatrical runtime: 150:07 ---><ref>{{citeweb|title=The Raid 2 |url=http://bbfc.co.uk/releases/raid-2-film |publisher=[[British Board of Film Classification]] |date=20 March 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2014}}</ref> | country = Indonesia | language = {{unbulleted list|[[Indonesian language|Indonesian]]|Japanese}} | budget = $4.5 million<ref>{{citeweb|title=Gareth Evans Talks THE RAID 2|url=http://collider.com/gareth-evans-the-raid-2-3-iron-fist-interview}}</ref> | gross = $6.6 million {{small|(does not include Indonesia and Japan)}}<ref>{{cite web|title=The Raid 2 (2014) - International Box Office Results|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=raid2.htm|website=[[Box Office Mojo]]|accessdate=15 February 2015}}</ref> }} '''''The Raid 2''''' ({{lang-id|'''The Raid 2: Berandal'''|lit=Thug}}; {{lang-ja|ザ・レイド Gokudo|lit=Gangster}})<ref name="Sony̠Classic-Raid2"/><ref name="Kadokawa-Gokudo"/><ref>{{citeweb|url=http://collider.com/raid-2-sequel-berandal-plot-details-filming/|title=First Scene of THE RAID Sequel, BERANDAL, Takes Place 2 Hours First Movie Ends; Filming Begins Later This Month|publisher=Collider}}</ref> is a 2014 Indonesian [[action film|action]] [[crime film]] written, directed and edited by the Welsh filmmaker [[Gareth Evans (director)|Gareth Evans]]. It is the [[sequel]] to the 2011 film ''[[The Raid (2011 film)|The Raid]]'' and stars [[Iko Uwais]], [[Arifin Putra]], [[Oka Antara]], [[Tio Pakusadewo]], [[Alex Abbad]], [[Julie Estelle]], [[Ryuhei Matsuda]], [[Kenichi Endō]], and [[Kazuki Kitamura]].
In the story, [[Mobile Brigade Corps (Brimob)|special forces]] officer Rama is sent [[undercover operation|undercover]] to expose the corrupt police officials colluding with the crime families of [[Jakarta]]'s [[criminal underworld]]. Like Evans' previous films ''[[Merantau]]'' and ''The Raid'', the fight scenes showcase the Indonesian fighting style of [[Pencak Silat]].
The film was released on 28 March 2014.<ref>{{cite news |last=Kit |first= Borys|date=2013-12-23|title= 'The Raid 2' Gets a Release Date |work=The Hollywood Reporter|url= http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/raid-2-gets-a-release-667515|accessdate=2013-12-23}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://twitter.com/ghuwevans/status/330971104158044160|title=Twitter: Killers - October / The Raid 2: Berandal - sometime next year still undecided. @ghuwevans|format=Twitter|date=2013-05-05}}</ref><ref name=release>{{citeweb|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=111048|title=Sony Pictures Classics and Stage 6 Film to Release The Raid 2 Domestically|publisher=ComingSoon.net}}</ref>
==Plot== <!--Please see [[WP:FILMPLOT]] before adding any material. The plot summary should be between 400–700 words. As of 2018-07-13 the plot section is 798 words-->
Two hours after the events of the first film, Jakarta crime boss Bejo executes Rama's brother Andi who took over from Tama, a gang boss operating under Bangun. Rama meets Lt. Bunawar, head of an internal investigation unit. He sends Bowo for treatment but has Lt. Wahyu executed. Bunawar assures Rama it was to protect him from crooked cops like Wahyu, saying courts cannot fix the problem. Testifying would only endanger him and his family. He asks him to go undercover to expose Reza's and other police officials' dealings with the Bangun and Goto crime syndicates. Rama agrees after Bejo murders Andi. Bunawar tasks him to infiltrate the underworld, befriending Bangun's son Uco. Using the alias "Yuda", Rama is told to assault the politician's son responsible for putting Uco in prison. Bunawar can arrest him and befriend Uco. In a riot a year into Uco's prison term, several assailants attempt to kill him. They are led by Benny who betrays Uco's trust before Yuda saves him. When Yuda is released two years later, Uco takes him to meet his father, who hires him out of gratitude. He proves his value to the family through his work under Uco and his father's consigliere Eka.
Uco is frustrated with his limited role in the organization and is furious when a bar girl calls him a "debt collector". When he leaves the room, Rama plants a bug in his wallet. Bangun meets the hitman Prakoso, who assassinates another of Bangun's targets.
Bejo invites Uco to dinner and tells him he has his eye on Gotos' controlled land. He shares rumors of a plot to turn Reza and others against his father. Bejo brings the assailants from the prison riot. Uco kills them. He notices a gang tattoo on Benny's wrist. They hatch a plot to start a gang war to disrupt the truce between the two families. Uco can prove himself to Bangun; Bejo can profit from carving up Hideaki Goto's territory. Uco lures Prakoso into an ambush. Prakoso is killed by The Assassin. Uco lies to his father saying the Japanese were responsible. Bangun will not counterattack. Frustrated, Uco phones Bejo saying "Just do it." Bejo's hitmen – Hammer Girl, Baseball Bat Man, and The Assassin – kill several of Goto's men, sparking a gang war between the families.
Rama is attacked during the conflict. He defeats the assailants and discovers a police ID on one of the attackers. When the families meet to reconcile, Uco lashes out in anger, embarrassing Bangun into conceding territory. Rama learns from Lt. Bunawar the attackers were Reza's corrupt cops sent after him. He receives a call from Eka to save Uco. Bangun beats Uco when they return to his office. While Yuda is on the way, Bejo and The Assassin barge in with a mob of henchmen. Revealing his betrayal, Uco kills his father and shoots Eka. Before Bejo can finish him off, Yuda arrives and Eka flees. The Assassin subdues Rama. Bejo commands his men to get rid of him. Eka follows. In a car chase several vehicles are destroyed before Yuda is rescued and driven to safety. Ryuichi informs Goto and Keichi that Reza was seen entering Bejo's restaurant. Goto tells Ryuichi to "take care of him". Ryuichi tells him Bejo is not alone. He informs him of Uco's betrayal of his father. Goto declares war against Bejo, Uco, and Reza. When his son Keichi interjects, Goto responds, "They're not cops anymore. They're in my world now." A bleeding and exhausted Eka tells Rama he knows he was also undercover. Rama calls Lt. Bunawar, who informs him the gang war escalated. The police commissioner was shot dead. Bunawar claims Eka "went rogue" and ten honest cops died. He informs him that Reza, the true objective, is meeting Bejo and Uco at the restaurant. Rama breaches its warehouse and fights through Bejo's men.
Bejo and Uco meet Reza to discuss terms against Goto. Still shaken from his act of patricide, Uco discovers the bug in his wallet. Uncertain who planted it, he notices Bejo has the same tattoo as Benny, suggesting the prison attack may have been another attempt to spark a gang war. Uco sits in shock realizing he has been used. Rama defeats Bejo's three hitmen and disrupts the meeting carrying The Assassin's pair of karambit. Bejo attempts to shoot him. Uco grabs another gun and shoots Reza dead. He shoots Bejo, before turning his gun towards Rama who throws the karambit at Uco then stabs him. Uco dies in his arms. Rama limps from the premises and encounters Keichi, Ryuichi and their men sent to attack the meeting. While Lt. Bunawar drives to the site, Keichi smirks as he shares a silent dialogue with Rama. Rama is heard saying, "No...I'm done."
==Cast== {{Div col}} * [[Iko Uwais]] as Rama/Yuda, a [[Mobile Brigade (Indonesia)|special forces]] member turned undercover agent. His alias "Yuda" is a reference to Uwais' character in his debut film ''[[Merantau]]''. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Cok Simbara|id}} as Bunawar, the head of the [[Internal affairs (law enforcement)|internal investigation]] unit who recruits Rama to oust police–mob collusion. * [[Arifin Putra]] as Uco, a nefarious mobster who is the impatient son and heir to Bangun. * [[Tio Pakusadewo]] as Bangun, a notorious kingpin who is one of the two mob bosses in control of Jakarta's underworld. * [[Oka Antara]] as Eka, Bangun's [[consigliere]] who holds a secret of his own. * [[Yayan Ruhian]] as Prakoso, Bangun's most loyal and dedicated hitman. * [[Alex Abbad]] as Bejo, a self-made Jakarta crime boss who considers himself very ambitious. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Cecep Arif Rahman|id}} as "The Assassin", Bejo's top enforcer who uses the ''[[karambit]]'' as his signature weapon. * [[Julie Estelle]] as Alicia/"Hammer Girl", a merciless assassin who uses [[claw hammers]] as her signature weapon. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Very Tri Yulisman|id}} as "Baseball Bat Man", Alicia's brother and one of Bejo's top three hitmen. * [[Kenichi Endō]] as Hideaki Goto, head of the Goto family and one of the two mob bosses in control of Jakarta's underworld. * [[Ryuhei Matsuda]] as Keichi, Goto's son and heir. * [[Kazuki Kitamura]] as Ryuichi, Goto's lieutenant and [[interpreter]]. * [[Roy Marten]] as Reza, a corrupt high-ranking police official affiliated with the Gotos, who Bejo wants to buy out in his plans for expansion. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Epy Kusnandar|id}} as Topan, operator of an illegal "porn den" in Bangun's territory, who receives a visit when word gets out he's expanded into the drug business. * [[Zack Lee]] as Benny, an associate of Uco in prison who betrays his trust. * [[Donny Alamsyah]] as Andi, Rama's brother who is executed by Bejo. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Tegar Satrya|id}} as Bowo, Rama's colleague and fellow survivor of the first film's eponymous raid. * {{Interlanguage link multi|Marsha Timothy|id}} as Dwi, Prakoso's estranged wife. {{div col end}} Other cast members include [[:id:Henky Solaiman|Henky Solaiman]] and [[:id:Fikha Effendi|Fikha Effendi]], who reprise their roles as Rama's father and wife Isa, respectively. Veteran actors [[:id:Deddy Sutomo|Deddy Sutomo]] and [[:id:Pong Hardjatmo|Pong Hardjatmo]] make cameos as the mediator and police commissioner, respectively.
==Production== ===Development=== Following ''[[Merantau]]'', director [[Gareth Evans (director)|Gareth Evans]] and his producers began to work on a project called ''Berandal'' (which is Indonesian for "thugs"), a large-scale prison gang film intended to star not only ''Merantau'' actors Iko Uwais and [[Yayan Ruhian]], but also an additional pair of international fight stars. A teaser trailer was shot, but the project proved to be more complex and time consuming than they had anticipated.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Brown |first=Todd |url=http://twitchfilm.com/news/2010/11/the-merantau-team-prepare-for-the-raid.php |title=The MERANTAU Team Prepare For THE RAID |publisher=[[Twitch Film]] |date=2010-11-15 |accessdate=2013-04-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120909033951/http://twitchfilm.com/news/2010/11/the-merantau-team-prepare-for-the-raid.php |archivedate=9 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> After a year and a half, Evans and the producers found themselves with insufficient funds to produce ''Berandal'', so they changed to a simpler, but different story with a smaller budget. They called the project ''Serbuan Maut'' (''The Raid''), which led to the creation of the first film.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Evans|first=Gareth |url=http://theraid-movie.blogspot.com/2011/02/introduction.html |title=The Raid: An Introduction |publisher=Theraid-movie.blogspot.com |date=2011-02-06 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref>
While developing ''The Raid'' in script form, Evans considered the idea of creating a link between it and the initial project, ''Berandal''. Following the release of ''The Raid'', it was later confirmed that ''Berandal'' would serve as a sequel to ''The Raid''.<ref>{{citeweb|authorlink=Gareth Evans (director) |last=Evans|first=Gareth|url=http://theraid-movie.blogspot.com/2011/03/camera-testing-press-conference.html |title=The Raid: Camera testing, the press conference, Berandal and sometimes this happens |publisher=Theraid-movie.blogspot.com |date=2011-03-05 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=http://screenrant.com/raid-redemption-sequel-berandal-gareth-evans-kofi-158935/ |title=‘The Raid: Redemption’ Director Talks Sequel Film, ‘Berandal’ |publisher=Screen Rant |date=2012-03-12 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref> Evans also said that he wanted to include car chases in the sequel, as well as a third ''Raid'' film being "a lot further down the line."<ref>{{citeweb |last=Jagernauth|first=Kevin|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/gareth-evans-spills-details-on-the-raid-sequel-berandal-has-trilogy-in-mind |title=Gareth Evans Spills Details On 'The Raid' Sequel 'Berandal'; Has Trilogy In Mind | The Playlist |publisher=Blogs.indiewire.com |date=2012-02-01 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref>
With the title for the North American market announced as ''The Raid 2'', the sequel has a "significantly larger" budget than its predecessor, and its production schedule took approximately 100 days.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Gilchrist|first=Todd |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/gareth-evans-berendal-raid-sequel-iko-uwais-286827 |title=Gareth Evans Set for 'The Raid' Sequel 'Berendal' |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=2012-03-12 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref> Pre-production began in September 2012 with filming in January 2013.<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/the-raid-director-gareth-evans-discusses-sequel-plans/ |title=‘The Raid’ Director Gareth Evans Discusses His Sequel Plans | /Film |publisher=Slashfilm.com |date=2012-03-12 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Ford|first=Rory|date=2012-02-17|title= Interview: Gareth Evans brings The Raid to GFF 2012|publisher=List.co.uk|url= http://film.list.co.uk/article/40465-interview-gareth-evans-brings-the-raid-to-gff-2012/|accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref>
===Casting and filming=== In December 2012, [[Screen Anarchy|Twitch]] confirmed that [[Julie Estelle]] was cast as "Hammer Girl"; Evans also tweeted that internationally renowned [[silat]] practitioner [[Cecep Arif Rahman]] was also given a major part in the film.<ref name="Casting">{{citeweb|last=Brown|first=Todd|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2012/12/berandal-aka-the-raid-2-announces-new-cast.html|title=BERANDAL (aka THE RAID 2) Announces New Cast, More Ass Kicking|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=2012-12-20|accessdate=2013-04-02|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130308070428/http://twitchfilm.com/2012/12/berandal-aka-the-raid-2-announces-new-cast.html|archivedate=8 March 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Marsha Timothy, Mathias Muchus, Tio Pakusadewo, and Alex Abbad, who worked with Evans in ''Merantau'', were also cast in the film.<ref name="Casting"/> Japanese actors [[Matsuda Ryuhei]], [[Kenichi Endō]], and [[Kitamura Kazuki]] also joined the cast.<ref>{{citeweb|last=Mack|first=Andrew|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/02/draft---ryuhei-matsuda-kenichi-endo-kazuki-kitamura-joing-the-raid-2-berandal.html|title=Matsuda Ryuhei, Endo Kenichi And Kitamura Kazuki Joining THE RAID 2: BERANDAL|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=2013-02-04|accessdate=2013-04-02|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130314051847/http://twitchfilm.com/2013/02/draft---ryuhei-matsuda-kenichi-endo-kazuki-kitamura-joing-the-raid-2-berandal.html|archivedate=14 March 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Evans also revealed on his Twitter that Yayan Ruhian, who played Mad Dog in ''The Raid'', will return for the sequel as a new character called Prakoso,<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/07/new-image-from-the-raid-2-berandal-yayan-ruhian-returns-as-prakoso.html |title=Mad Dog May Be Dead But Check Out Yayan Ruhian As Prakoso In THE RAID 2 |author=Mack, Andrew |date=2 July 2013 |website=[[Twitch Film]] |publisher= |accessdate=9 September 2014}}</ref> the machete-wielding chief assassin of Bangun. He claimed that he would not do a martial arts film without Ruhian being involved.<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.empireonline.com/features/the-raid-2-berandal-trailer-gareth-evans/p9 |title=Gareth Evans On The Raid 2: Berandal Trailer |author=Hewitt, Chris |date= |website=[[Empire Magazine]] |publisher=Bauer Consumer Media Ltd |accessdate=9 September 2014}}</ref> Ruhian, who is a choreographer of the film, also trained Estelle in [[pencak silat]].<ref>{{cite news|language=Indonesian|url=http://www.joyindonesia.com/julie-estelle-ketagihan-belajar-silat/|title=JULIE ESTELLE KETAGIHAN BELAJAR SILAT!|date=5 February 2013|publisher=Antaranews.com|accessdate=2 April 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130216011349/http://www.joyindonesia.com/julie-estelle-ketagihan-belajar-silat/|archivedate=16 February 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In January 2013, PT Merantau Films and [[XYZ Films]] announced the start of production.<ref name=announce>{{citeweb |last=Mack|first=Andrew|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/01/the-raid-2-berandal-starts-shooting-and-punching-and-kicking-in-indonesia.html|title=THE RAID 2: BERANDAL Starts Shooting (And Punching And Kicking) In Indonesia!|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=2013-01-30 |accessdate=2013-04-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= 'The Raid 2' Begins Production (Exclusive Photos)|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=2013-01-31|url= http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/raid-2-begins-production-photos-417287|accessdate=22 April 2014|first=Borys |last=Kit}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= ‘The Raid 2′ Begins Production, Behind the Scenes Photos Released|publisher=Slashfilm.com|date=2013-02-01|url= http://www.slashfilm.com/the-raid-2-begins-production-behind-the-scenes-photos-released/|accessdate=22 April 2014|first=Russ |last=Fischer}}</ref> The filming process took about seven months and ended in July 2013.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Moore|first=Debi|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/69007/its-wrap-raid-2-berandal#axzz2punJ7o6r|title=It's a Wrap for The Raid 2: Berandal!|publisher=[[Dread Central]]|date=2013-07-27|accessdate=2014-01-09}}</ref>
The film's lead cinematographer Matt Flannery tweeted that at least three [[Red Digital Cinema Camera Company|RED]] cameras were used in a test shoot of a chase scene.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://twitter.com/Matt_Flannery/status/280476011865464833|title=Twitter: Test cam shooting today... @Matt_Flannery|format=Twitter|date=16 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://twitter.com/Matt_Flannery/status/280517135229415424|title=Twitter: Fuck 3D, let's 4D. @Matt_Flannery|format=Twitter|date=16 December 2012}}</ref> Gareth Evans mentioned on his Twitter that they were using RED Scarlet for 95% of the shoot, Epic for slow mo, and Go Pro 3 for quick cuts during the car chase.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://twitter.com/ghuwevans/status/421095202900541440|title=Twitter: RED Scarlet for 95% of the shoot, Epic for slow mo, Go Pro 3 for quick cuts during the car chase... @ghuwevans|format=Twitter|date=8 January 2014}}</ref>
===Marketing=== A [[teaser campaign|teaser trailer]] was released at [[Twitch Film]] on 6 November 2013.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Brown|first=Todd|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/11/indonesian-teaser-premiere-for-the-raid-2-berandal-get-your-first-taste-of-the-action-now.html|title=Indonesian Teaser Premiere For THE RAID 2: BERANDAL! Get Your First Taste Of The Action Now!|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=6 November 2013|accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref> ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' stated that the trailer "unleashes more action than most Hollywood blockbusters."<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/raid-2-berandal-trailer-unleashes-653976 |title=The Raid 2: Berandal Trailer Unleashes More Action Than Most Hollywood Blockbusters|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref>
A longer Indonesian trailer was released on 31 December 2013.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Brown|first=Todd|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/12/watch-the-full-indonesian-trailer-for-the-raid-2-now.html|title=Watch The Full Indonesian Trailer For THE RAID 2 Now!|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=31 December 2013|accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref> The American trailer was released on 21 January 2014.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://screenrant.com/the-raid-2-berandal-movie-trailer/ |title="The Raid 2: Berandal" US Trailer: One Cop Against The Underworld|date=26 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= The Raid 2: Berandal gets new trailer, critics go crazy over it at Sundance Film Festival|publisher=Metro.co.uk|date=2014-01-22|url= http://metro.co.uk/2014/01/22/the-raid-2-berandal-gets-new-trailer-critics-go-crazy-over-it-at-sundance-film-festival-4273003/|accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Ann |last=Lee}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Full US Theatrical Trailer for The Raid 2|publisher=Bleeding Cool|date=2014-01-21|url= http://www.bleedingcool.com/2014/01/21/full-us-theatrical-trailer-for-the-raid-2/|accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Linda |last=Ge}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= ‘The Raid 2′ Trailer: This May be the Biggest, Craziest Action Movie of 2014|publisher=Screen Crush|date=21 January 2014|url= http://screencrush.com/raid-2-full-trailer/|accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Jacob |last=Hall}}</ref>
On 26 March 2014, a deleted scene from the film titled "[[The Raid 2#Deleted scenes|Gang War]]" was released to promote the film.<ref name=":2">{{citeweb|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fs_Qhmiz40E|title = The Raid 2 - Deleted Scene 'Gang War'|date = |accessdate = 24 December 2014|website = |publisher = |last= |first = }}</ref>
==International release== The film was marketed internationally through Celluloid Nightmares, a partnership between US-based [[XYZ Films]] and France's [[Celluloid Dreams]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/news/xyz-films-forms-int-l-sales-division-1118066093/|title=XYZ Films forms international sales division |publisher=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |last=McNary|first=Dave |date=11 February 2013 |accessdate=14 March 2016}}</ref><ref name="deadline"/>
[[Sony Pictures Worldwide Acquisitions]] acquired the film's distribution rights for the United States,<ref name="Sony̠Classic-Raid2">{{citeweb|url = http://sonyclassics.com/theraid2/ |title=''The Raid 2'' |publisher=[[Sony Pictures Classics]]}}</ref> Latin America and Spain; and [[Kadokawa Pictures]] for Japan.<ref name="Kadokawa-Gokudo">{{citeweb|url=http://www.kadokawa-pictures.jp/official/theraid2/ |title=ザ・レイド GOKUDO |publisher=[[Kadokawa Pictures]]}}</ref> Distribution rights to other countries were sold to [[eOne Entertainment]] for Canada and the United Kingdom; [[Koch Media]] for Germany, Switzerland and Austria; Calinos Films for Turkey; HGC for China; and [[Madman Entertainment]] for Australia.<ref name="deadline">{{citeweb|url= http://www.deadline.com/2012/02/sony-nabs-rights-for-the-raid-sequel |title= Sony Nabs U.S. Rights For ‘The Raid’ Sequel |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=2 December 2012 |last=Brooks|first=Brian |accessdate=2012-03-19}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url= http://www.thewrap.com/raid-2-hit-u-s-theaters-via-sony-classics-stage-6-films/ |title= ‘The Raid 2' to Hit U.S. Theaters Via Sony Classics, Stage 6 Films |publisher=The Wrap |first=Jeff |last=Sneider |date=5 November 2013|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref>
==Reception== The film had its world [[Film premiere|premiere]] at the [[2014 Sundance Film Festival]] on 21 January 2014.<ref>{{citeweb|last=Aldrich|first=Ryland|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2013/12/the-raid-2-leads-sundance-2014-premieres-announcement-gallery.html|title=THE RAID 2 Leads Sundance 2014 Premieres Announcement|publisher=[[Twitch Film]]|date=2013-12-09|accessdate=2014-01-09|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140109165431/http://twitchfilm.com/2013/12/the-raid-2-leads-sundance-2014-premieres-announcement-gallery.html|archivedate=9 January 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> It also screened at [[South by Southwest]] on 10 March 2014<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://dfw.com/2014/03/11/875674/sxsw-the-raid-2-is-better-late.html |title=The Raid 2 better late than never|publisher=dfw.com|accessdate=12 March 2014}}</ref> and ARTE Indonesia Arts Festival on 14 March 2014.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2014/03/09/114560639/The-Raid-2-Premieres-at-ARTE-Festival |title=The Raid 2 Premieres at ARTE Festival|publisher=Tempo (English)|accessdate=17 March 2014}}</ref> Following a [[wide release]] on 11 April 2014, due to low returns the majority of theaters closed the film one week later. This was similar to what occurred during the theatrical run of the first film.<ref>{{citeweb |last=Mendelson|first=Scott|title='The Raid 2' Bombed, But Sony Deserved Kudos For Going Wide|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2014/04/15/the-raid-2-bombed-but-sony-deserves-kudos-for-going-wide/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=17 April 2014}}</ref>
===Censorship=== ''The Raid 2'' was [[Film Censorship Board of Malaysia|banned]] in neighboring [[Malaysia]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.colourlessopinions.com/2014/03/raid-2-banned-malaysia.html |title=The Raid 2: Berandal banned in Malaysia|publisher=Colourlessopinions.com|accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref> The film was scheduled to hit Malaysian screens on 28 March, but had not been shown anywhere in the country due to its excessive violence.<ref>{{cite news|title='The Raid 2: Berandal' banned due to excessive violence|url=http://english.astroawani.com/entertainment-news/raid-2-berandal-banned-due-excessive-violence-33469?cp}}</ref> Indonesian politician, and former [[:id:Kepala Staf TNI Angkatan Darat|Army Chief of Staff]], [[Pramono Edhie Wibowo]] criticized the decision and demanded an explanation. He further asked the Indonesian [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Indonesia)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] to "actively perform its mediation function with the Malaysian government."<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/presidential-hopeful-criticizes-malaysia-reported-banning-raid-2/ |title=Presidential Hopeful Criticizes Malaysia for Reported Banning of 'The Raid 2' |publisher=[[Jakarta Globe]] |date=1 April 2014}}</ref>
The US release was given an R rating by the [[Motion Picture Association of America|MPAA]] for "strong bloody violence throughout, sexuality and language",<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.ropeofsilicon.com/mpaa-ratings-divergent-raid-2-filth-double-todays-ratings-bulletin/ |title=MPAA Ratings for 'Divergent', 'The Raid 2', 'Filth' and 'The Double' in Today's Ratings Bulletin|publisher=RopeOfSilicon.com|accessdate=13 April 2014}}</ref> cutting a few frames of graphic violence. Director Evans stated the cuts are very minimal and similar to his original cut.<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.movie-censorship.com/news.php?ID=6774 |title=The Raid 2 - Director Talks MPAA and Extended Cut|publisher=Movie-censorship.com|accessdate=13 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.collider.com/gareth-evans-the-raid-2-3-iron-fist-interview/ |title=Gareth Evans Talks THE RAID 2, Deleted Scenes, the Budget, the MPAA, John Woo, THE RAID 3, IRON FIST, Future Projects, Hollywood, and More at Sundance|publisher=Collider.com|accessdate=13 April 2014}}</ref> The film received an R-15 [[Eirin|rating in Japan]] with 4 minutes cut, and an R-18 uncut version which was screened in the [[Tokyo metropolitan area]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.cinematoday.jp/news/N0068771 |title=「ザ・レイド GOKUDO」 R18+版の上映決定！“ありのまま”のアクション満載 |publisher=[[:ja:シネマトゥデイ|CinemaToday]] |date=4 December 2014}}</ref>
===Critical response=== {{Album reviews | MC = 71/100<ref name="Metacritic"/> | aggregate1 = [[Rotten Tomatoes]] | aggregate1score = 80%<ref name="Rotten Tomatoes"/> | rev1 = ''[[The Guardian]]'' | rev1score = {{rating|4|5}}<ref name="The Guardian">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/apr/10/the-raid-2-gareth-evans-action-martial-arts-review|title=The Raid 2 review – Owww! Whoa!|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|first=Peter|last=Bradshaw|date=10 April 2014|accessdate=11 January 2018}}</ref> | rev2 = ''[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]]''| rev2score = {{rating|4|5}}<ref name="Empire rev">{{cite web|url=https://www.empireonline.com/movies/raid-2/review/|title=The Raid 2 review|publisher=''[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]]''|first=Nick De|last=Semlyen|date=21 July 2016|accessdate=11 January 2018}}</ref> | rev3 = ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''| rev3score = B+<ref name="EW rev"/> | rev4 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]''| rev4score = {{rating|3.5|4}}<ref name="RS rev"/> | rev5 = [[Roger Ebert|RogerEbert.com]]| rev5score = {{rating|2|4}}<ref name="RogerEbert rev">{{cite web|url=https://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/the-raid-2-2014|title=The Raid 2 movie review & film summary (2014)|publisher=[[Roger Ebert|RogerEbert.com]]|first=Glenn|last=Kenny|date=28 March 2014|accessdate=11 January 2018}}</ref> | rev6 = [[AllMovie]]| rev6score = {{rating|5|5}}<ref name="AllMovie rev">{{cite web|url=https://www.allmovie.com/movie/the-raid-2-v577344/review|title=The Raid 2 (2014) – Gareth Evans {{!}} Review|publisher=[[AllMovie]]|first=Jason|last=Buchanan|accessdate=11 January 2018}}</ref> }}
''The Raid 2'' has received positive reviews. Review aggregation website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gave the film a 80% approval rating, with an average score of 7.4/10, based on reviews from 165 critics. The site's consensus states: "Although its high-energy plot and over-the-top violence may play better with genre aficionados, ''The Raid 2'' definitely delivers more of everything audiences loved about its predecessor."<ref name="Rotten Tomatoes">{{citeweb|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_raid_2/ |title=The Raid 2 (2014)|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=8 November 2018}}</ref> The film has a score of 71/100 on [[Metacritic]], indicating "generally favorable reviews", based on 33 critics.<ref name="Metacritic">{{citeweb|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/the-raid-2 |title=The Raid 2|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=23 June 2014}}</ref>
During its world premiere at [[2014 Sundance Film Festival|Sundance]], ''The Raid 2'' received an overwhelming reaction. Mark Olsen of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' reported that "The screening caused an explosion of excitement and enthusiasm for the film on social media."<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/sundance-film-festival/la-et-mn-sundance-2014-the-raid-2-movie-sundance-festival-trailer-20140122-story.html|title = Sundance 2014: 'The Raid 2' hits festival hard; trailer released |last= Olsen|first = Mark|date = 22 January 2014|publisher=Los Angeles Times|accessdate = 21 December 2014}}</ref>
In a 3-out-of-5 mixed review, Joey Magidson of the website ''[[Awards Circuit]]'' wrote that he "appreciate(s) the directing skills on display in ''The Raid 2'', but at a certain point, all of the fighting and killing nearly got to be too much for me. I’m recommending the film, but not in the same way as the last one."<ref name=":0">{{citeweb|url = http://www.awardscircuit.com/2014/03/26/raid-2-%E2%98%85%E2%98%85%E2%98%85/|title = The Raid 2 (★★★)|date = 26 March 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = Awards Circuit|publisher = |last= Magidson|first = Joey}}</ref> He added that while it is "creative enough to be worth a recommendation, it lacks the originality of the first flick" and concluded that "''The Raid 2 ''will delight genre fans, but might not impress to many others."<ref name=":0" />
Chris Nashawaty of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' said, "''The Raid 2'' will make you feel like Christmas came nine months early. Some action sequels don't know when to say when. But here's one where too much is just the right amount."<ref name="EW rev">{{citeweb|url=https://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20800407,00.html |title=The Raid 2 Review|publisher=''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''|first=Chris|last=Nashawaty|date=14 April 2014|accessdate=21 December 2014}}</ref>
Simon Abrams of ''[[Roger Ebert|RogerEbert.com]]'' praised the film for its "involving plot"; calling the cast, especially Uwais, "charming" and dialogue "winningly precise" while noting that the sequel is "a great step up after the already-impressive ''[[The Raid (2011 film)|The Raid]]''."<ref>{{citeweb|url = http://www.rogerebert.com/festivals-and-awards/sundance-report-the-trip-to-italy-and-the-raid-2|title = Sundance Report: The Trip to Italy and The Raid 2|date = 24 January 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = RogerEbert.com|publisher = |last= Abrams|first = Simon}}</ref>
David Rooney of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' gave the film a positive review, remarking, "Evans gives the audience a knowing wink by having Rama endure repeated batterings that would leave mere mortals in traction, not to mention some nasty blade wounds. Yet he keeps coming back, finding the stamina to snap more limbs and crush more skulls. Taking place inside moving vehicles, a subway car, a noodle bar, warehouses, a porn factory, tight corridors and in the most electrifying mano-a-mano clash, a gleaming nightclub kitchen and wine cellar, the fights are dynamite."<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/raid-2-sundance-review-673197 |title=The Raid 2 Sundance Review|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref>
''[[Rolling Stone]]'' chief critic [[Peter Travers]] wrote, "''The Raid 2'' lets its warriors rip for two and a half thrilling hours. With the precision of dance and the punch of a K.O. champion, Evans keeps the action coming like nobody's business."<ref name="RS rev">{{citeweb|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/the-raid-2-20140327 |title=The Raid 2 Review|publisher=''[[Rolling Stone]]''|author=[[Peter Travers|Travers, Peter]]|date=27 March 2014|accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref>
Many have praised the film for matching the action sequences that made the first film so great, as well as improving upon the plot and the dialogue, which its predecessor was criticized for.
Amber Wilkinson of ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' commented, "Hyper-violent it may be but there is beauty in its brutality," and wrote, "To say a martial arts movie brings something fresh in terms of choreography may sound like fighting talk, but Gareth Evans's sequel to his 2011 film is endlessly inventive."<ref>{{cite news |last=Wilkinson |first=Amber |date=23 January 2014 |title=Sundance 2014, The Raid 2: Berandal, review |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/filmreviews/10591571/Sundance-2014-The-Raid-2-Berandal-review.html |publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' |location=London |accessdate=3 April 2014}}</ref>
Matt Risley of ''[[Total Film]]'' gave the film 5 stars and wrote: "Sumptuously shot, perfectly paced and flat-out exhilarating, ''The Raid 2'' cements Evans as the best action director working today and may not be the best action, gangster, or even martial-arts movie ever made. But as a combination of all three, it's unparalleled in recent memory and offers a tantalising glimpse into a post-Bayhem action-movie world. Brutal, beautiful and brilliant" and also wrote, "The sheer imagination on show, both in the cinematography and choreography, guarantees each brawl is instantly iconic. Immaculately edited, each traumatic, tensely tactile fight would blur into chaos if not for Evans's pinpoint pacing something that refreshes all the more in the face of modern blockbusting's tendency to start big and just keep getting bigger, until burnout."<ref>{{cite news |last=Risley |first=Matt |date=6 March 2014 |title=The Raid 2 |url=http://www.totalfilm.com/reviews/cinema/the-raid-2 |publisher=[[Total Film]] |accessdate=3 April 2014}}</ref>
===Year-end lists=== The film appeared on several critics' year-end lists. * #07 – [[Internet Movie Database|IMDb]]<nowiki/>'s "Top 10 Films of 2014"<ref>{{citeweb|url = http://www.darkhorizons.com/news/35091/imdb-unveils-top-films-tv-of-2014-list|title = IMDb Unveils Top Film & TV of 2014|date = 16 December 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = Dark Horizons|publisher = |last= Franklin|first = Garth}}</ref> * #10 – Drew McWeeny of [[HitFix]]<nowiki/>'s "Top 50 Films of 2014"<ref>{{citeweb|url = http://www.hitfix.com/motion-captured/from-rocket-raccoon-to-amazing-amy-our-runners-up-for-2014s-best-movies|title = From Rocket to Raccoon to Amazing Amy|date = 12 December 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = |publisher = [[HitFix]] |last= McWeeny|first = Drew}}</ref> * #10 – DenOfGeek.com<nowiki/>'s "Top 10 Films of 2014"<ref>{{citeweb|url = http://www.denofgeek.com/movies/top-10-of-2014/33403/the-top-10-films-of-2014-the-raid-2|title = Top 20 Films 2014: The Raid 2|date = |accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = DenofGeek.com|publisher = |last= Gea|first = Becky}}</ref> * #14 – Rob Hunter of [[Film School Rejects]]<nowiki/>'s "14 Best Foreign Language Films of 2014"<ref>{{citeweb|url = http://filmschoolrejects.com/features/14-best-foreign-language-films-2014.php|title = 14 Best Foreign Language Films of 2014|date = 18 December 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|website = |publisher = Film School Rejects |last= Hunter|first = Rob}}</ref> * #02 – Peter Freeman of DCOutlook.com's "Top 10 Movies of 2014"<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.dcoutlook.com/2014/12/dc-outlooks-top-10-movies-of-2014.html|title=DC Outlook's Top 10 Movies of 2014|author=Peter Freeman|publisher=dcoutlook.com}}</ref>
==Accolades== ''The Raid 2'' has garnered a number of nominations and wins from both domestic and international awards.
On 19 December 2014, it won the award for [[Florida Film Critics Circle Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]] from the [[Florida Film Critics Circle Awards 2014|Florida Film Critics Circle]] over [[Sweden]]'s ''[[Force Majeure]]'' and [[Poland]]'s ''[[Ida (film)|Ida]]'';<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.floridafilmcritics.com/2014/12/19/2014-ffcc-award-winners/|title = 2014 FFCC Awards Winners |last= Florida Film Critics Circle|first = |date = 19 December 2014|publisher=|accessdate = 21 December 2014}}</ref> a first for an Indonesian film. It also received two nominations at the 2014 Phoenix Film Critics Society Awards, for Best Stunts, and Best Foreign Language Film;<ref name=":1">{{citeweb|url = https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2265171/awards|title = The Raid 2|date = 2014|accessdate = 21 December 2014|publisher =[[IMDb]] |last= |first = }}</ref> losing the former to ''[[Edge of Tomorrow (film)|Edge of Tomorrow]] ''and the latter to [[Cinema of Poland|Polish film]], ''[[Ida (film)|Ida]]''. Another nomination came from the [[Chicago Film Critics Association Awards 2014|2014 Chicago Film Critics Association Awards]] on the [[Chicago Film Critics Association Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]] category, which it lost to [[Ruben Östlund]]'s ''[[Force Majeure]]'' from Sweden. For the [[Houston Film Critics Society Awards 2014|8th Houston Film Critics Society Awards]], it also received a nomination in the foreign film category, again losing to ''Force Majeure''.
The film received 10 nominations at the local [[2014 Maya Awards]], organized by online film community ''Piala Maya''. On 20 December 2014, it won four of its ten nominations: Best Cinematography for Matt Flanery and Dimas Subono, Best Editing for Evans and Andi Novianto, Best Special Effects, and Best Supporting Actor for [[Arifin Putra]]. It was also nominated for Best Film, Best Original Score, Most Memorable Featured Appearance for [[Julie Estelle]] as 'The Hammer Girl' (all three lost to ''[[:id:Cahaya Dari Timur: Beta Maluku|Cahaya dari Timur]]''); Best Hair & Make-Up and Best Sound Mixing (both lost to ''[[Killers (2014 film)|Killers]]''), as well as another nomination in the Best Supporting Actor category for [[Oka Antara]] (who lost to co-star Arifin Putra).<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://beritabulukumba.com/25504/daftar-pemenang-piala-maya-2014|title = Daftar Pemenang Piala Maya 2014 |last= |first = |date = 20 December 2014|publisher=Berita Bulu Kumba|accessdate = 21 December 2014}}</ref>

== Possible sequel == On 6 January 2014, media outlets quoted director Gareth Evans stating that ''The Raid 3'' will take place two hours before the end of ''The Raid 2''.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.totalfilm.com/news/gareth-evans-teases-the-raid-3 |title=Gareth Evans teases The Raid 3|publisher=[[Total Film]]|accessdate=23 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Director Gareth Evans Says 'The Raid 3' Starts 2 Hours Before 'The Raid 2' Ends|publisher=''[[IndieWire]]''|date=2014-01-06|url= http://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/director-gareth-evans-says-the-raid-3-starts-2-hours-before-the-raid-2-ends-20140106|accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Kevin |last=Jagernauth}}</ref> On 19 April, during an interview with ''[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]'', director Evans said that he is planning to take a break from martial arts movies for two or three years before filming it.<ref>{{cite news|title= The Raid 3 will be a prequel to The Raid 2, says director Gareth Evans |date=2014-04-19|url= http://metro.co.uk/2014/04/19/the-raid-3-will-be-a-prequel-to-the-raid-2-says-director-gareth-evans-4703446/ |publisher=''[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]'' |accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Sarah |last=Deen}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= The Raid 3 details teased by Gareth Evans, director says a Raid 2 scene ‘sets off a chain of events’ |date=2014-04-02|url= https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/raid-3-gareth-evans-says-3341295 |publisher=''[[Daily Mirror]]'' |accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Danny |last=Walker}}</ref> ''The Raid 3'' was planned for a 2018 or 2019 release.<ref>{{cite news|title= The Raid 3 |publisher=Bloody Disgusting|date=2014-04-02|url= http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3328934/dont-expect-third-raid-anytime-soon/|accessdate=23 April 2014|first=Danny |last=Walker}}</ref>
However, in a 21 November 2016 interview with ''Impact Online'', director Evans revealed the sequel was on hold with the franchise likely having ended, stating "Moving back to UK felt like a closing chapter on that franchise—we ended the story pretty neatly (I feel) in Part 2. I'm aware there's an interest for it {{small|[...]}} So never say never, but it's unlikely to happen anytime soon."<ref>{{citeweb|url=http://www.impactonline.co/film/12859-gareth-evans-apostle/ |title=Gareth Evans sings the praises of ‘Apostle’ |publisher=''[[Impact (action entertainment magazine)|Impact]]''|date=21 November 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161122183224/http://www.impactonline.co/film/12859-gareth-evans-apostle/ |archivedate=22 November 2016}}</ref>

{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox Website | name = Women in Refrigerators | logo = | screenshot = | caption = Screenshot of Women in Refrigerators, May 21, 2008 | url = [http://lby3.com/wir/ lby3.com/wir] | commercial = | type = [[Comic book]] | language = English | registration = No | owner = [[Gail Simone]] | author = Daniel Merlin Goodbrey
Rob Harris
Gail Simone
Beau Yarbrough
John Bartol | launch date = March 1999 | current status = Online | revenue = | slogan = }} '''Women in Refrigerators''' (or '''WiR''') is a [[website]] created in 1999[[Simone, Gail]] (March 1999). [http://www.lby3.com/wir "Women in Refrigerators"]. LBY3. Retrieved August 24, 2013. by a group of [[feminist]] comic book fans that lists examples of the comic book [[Trope (literature)|trope]] whereby female characters are injured, raped, killed, or depowered (an event colloquially known as '''fridging''') as a [[plot device]], and seeks to analyze why these plot devices are allegedly used disproportionately on female characters. ==History== [[File:WomaninRefrigerator.jpg|thumb|left|Panel from ''Green Lantern'' #54, the origin of the phrase]] The term "Women in Refrigerators" was coined by writer [[Gail Simone]] as a name for the website in early 1999 during online discussions about comic books with friends. It refers to an incident in ''[[Green Lantern]]'' #54 (1994), written by [[Ron Marz]], in which [[Kyle Rayner]], the title hero, comes home to his apartment to find that his girlfriend, [[Alexandra DeWitt]], had been killed by the villain [[Major Force]] and stuffed into a [[refrigerator]].Condon, Michael (October 2002). [http://www.fanzing.com/mag/fanzing49/condonquiz.shtml "The Fanzig Challenge"]. Fanzing. Retrieved January 11, 2006.Prowse-Gany, Brian (August 12, 2015). [https://www.yahoo.com/katiecouric/rise-of-the-female-superhero-ever-since-superman-126459307033.html "Rise of the Female Superhero"]. [[Yahoo! News]]. Simone and her colleagues then developed a list of fictional female characters who had been "killed, maimed or depowered", in particular in ways that treated the female character as merely a device to move a male character's story arc forward, rather than as a fully developed character in her own right.Simone, Gail (March 1999). [http://www.lby3.com/wir/women.html "The List"]. lb3.com. Retrieved August 24, 2013. The list was then circulated via the [[Internet]] over [[Usenet]], [[bulletin board system]]s, [[e-mail]] and [[electronic mailing list]]s. Simone also e-mailed many comic book creators directly for their responses to the list. The list is infamous in certain comic book fan circles. Respondents often found different meanings to the list itself, though Simone maintained that her simple point had always been: "If you demolish most of the characters girls like, then girls won't read comics. That's it!"Simone, Gail (March 28, 1999). [http://www.lby3.com/wir/r-4_2899.html "Email as of 4/28/99"]. LBY3. Retrieved January 11, 2006. Journalist Beau Yarbrough created the initial design and coding on the original site. Technology consultant John Bartol edited the content. Robert Harris,{{cite web|url=http://www.gayleague.com/members/profiles/displayProfile.php?id=181 |title=Who's Who: The Scarlet Rob |publisher=Gay League |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2010}} a librarian and comic-book fan, contributed to site maintenance and updates along with fan John Norris. The idea for placing the list online originated with software developer Jason Yu, who also served as the original site host.{{cite web|url=http://www.lby3.com/wir/index.html |title=Women in Refrigerators |publisher=lby3.com |date= |accessdate=December 21, 2012}} ===Creator response=== Simone received numerous e-mail responses from comic book fans and professionals. Some responses were neutral and others were positive.Simone, Gail; Bartol, John (Editors). [http://www.lby3.com/wir/reacts.html "Fan Reactions"]. "Women in Refigerators". Retrieved August 24, 2013. Additionally, arguments on the merits of the list were published on comic-book fan sites in early 1999. Simone published many of the responses she received on the website. Several comic book creators indicated that the list caused them to pause and think about the stories they were creating. Often these responses contained arguments for or against the use of death or injury of female characters as a plot device. A list of some responses from comic book professionals is included at the site.Simone, Gail; Harris Rob (Editors). [http://www.lby3.com/wir/creators.html "Responding Creators"]. Women in Refrigerators. LBY3. Retrieved August 24, 2013. Marz's reply stated (in part) "To me the real difference is less male–female than main character-supporting character. In most cases, main characters, "title" characters who support their own books, are male. ... the supporting characters are the ones who suffer the more permanent and shattering tragedies. And a lot of supporting characters are female."[http://www.lby3.com/wir/c-rmar.html "Ron Marz responds"]. Women in Refrigerators. LBY3. Retrieved August 24, 2013. ===Dead Men Defrosting=== In response to fans who argued that male characters are also often killed, content editor John Bartol wrote "Dead Men Defrosting", an article arguing that when male heroes are killed or altered, they are more typically returned to their [[status quo]]. According to Bartol, after most female characters are altered they are "never allowed, as male heroes usually are, the chance to return to their original heroic states. And that's where we begin to see the difference."Bartol, John (March 1999). [http://www.lby3.com/wir/r-jbartol2.html "Dead Men Defrosting"]. Women in Refrigerators. LBY3. Retrieved August 24, 2013. ==In popular culture== ===References in mass culture=== In 2000, several national newspapers ran articles that referenced the site, generating discussion on the topic of [[sexism]] in [[pop culture]] and the comic-book industry.{{cite web |url=http://www.dallasobserver.com/news/letters-6400564 |title=Letters: Wonder women |date=May 25, 2000 |publisher=Dallas Observer |access-date=August 31, 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20000903133408/http:/www.dallasobserver.com/issues/2000-05-25/letters.html |archivedate=September 3, 2000 |deadurl=no}} Some universities also list the content of Women in Refrigerators as related to analysis and critique of pop culture.{{cite web|url=http://www.wsu.edu/~amerstu/pop/comix.html |title=Popular Culture|publisher=[[Washington State University]]|date=|accessdate=August 24, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://perrymoorestories.com/content/hero.asp?id=superheroes |last=Moore |first=Perry |title=Who cares about the death of a gay superhero anyway? |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071012225358/http://perrymoorestories.com/content/hero.asp?id=superheroes |archivedate=October 12, 2007 |deadurl=yes |accessdate=August 31, 2017}} ===Women in Refrigerators Syndrome=== Women in Refrigerators Syndrome was coined in various forms via online discussions and articles.{{cite web |last=Voulieris |first=John |title=What Women Want |url=http://www.comicsbulletin.com/main/sites/default/files/soapbox/111344749759399..htm |accessdate=August 20, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070312031345/http://www.silverbulletcomicbooks.com/soapbox/111344749759399.htm |archivedate=May 19, 2005 |website=comicsbulletin.com |quote=And then every now and then you get the girlfriend in the refrigerator syndrome and it probably turns potential female readers off.}} The term describes the use of the death or injury of a female comic book character as a plot device in a story starring a male comic book character. It is also used to note the depowerment or elimination of a female comic-book character. Cases of it deal with a gruesome injury or murder of a female character at the hands of a [[supervillain]], usually as a motivating personal tragedy for a male [[superhero]], to whom the victim is connected. The death or injury of the female character, then helps cement the hatred between the hero and the villain responsible. [[Kyle Rayner]] is a particularly cited example, due to the common tragedies that befall women in his life.{{cite web |last=Krause ||first=Melissa |title=Point/Counterpoint in the Blogosphere... |url=http://blog.newsarama.com/2007/07/06/pointcounterpoint-in-the-blogosphere-48/ |date=July 6, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071013134235/http://blog.newsarama.com/2007/07/06/pointcounterpoint-in-the-blogosphere-48/ |archivedate=October 13, 2017 |website=Newsarama |deadurl=yes}} Discussing the site in his book ''Dangerous Curves: Action Heroes, Gender, Fetishism and Popular Culture'', [[Bowling Green State University]] professor Jeffrey A. Brown noted that while male comic book heroes have tended to die heroically and be magically brought back from the dead afterwards, female characters have been likelier to be casually but irreparably wounded or killed, often in a sexualized fashion. To support his claim, he cited the [[Joker (comics)|Joker]] shattering the original [[Batgirl]]'s spine just for fun, resulting in her being restricted to a wheelchair for over a decade, and the villain [[Black Mask (comics)|Black Mask]] binding, torturing and killing the first female [[Robin (comics)|Robin]] from [[DC Universe]], [[Stephanie Brown (comics)|Stephanie Brown]].{{cite book|last=Brown|first=Jeffrey A.|title=Dangerous curves: action heroines, gender, fetishism, and popular culture|publisher=University Press of Mississippi|location=Jackson|isbn=160473714X|pages=175–6}} ==Notable alumni== Several contributors to the site and the original list later became comic book creators and entertainment industry professionals. *Stephen Cmelak – creator of the webcomic ''Avatars''.{{cite web|url=http://www.avatarsonline.net/ |title=Avatars' official website |publisher=Avatarsonline.net |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2010}} * [[Daniel Merlin Goodbrey]] – digital designer and underground comicbook author, creator of the hypercomic ''Six-Gun: Tales from an Unfolded Earth'', and the [[iPod]] comic ''Brain Fist''.{{cite web|url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/columns/sixgun/ |title=Sixgun: Tales From An Unfolded Earth |publisher=[[Comic Book Resources]]|date= |accessdate=November 8, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://www.e-merl.com/brain.php |title=Brain Fist |publisher=E-merl.com |date=August 7, 2007 |accessdate=November 8, 2010}} *Brian Joines – writer of the independent comic ''The 7 Guys of Justice'' and as of 2006 publishing new comics through [[Platinum Studios]].[http://lby3.com/wir/reacts.html "Fan Reactions"]. Women in Refrigerators. Retrieved September 9, 2013.Weiland, Jonah (December 27, 2002). [http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=1686 "'7 Guys of Justice' return this July in special giant-sized issue"]. Comic Book Resources. *[[Greg Dean Schmitz]] – creator of ''UpcomingMovies.com'', AKA ''Greg's Previews'', and columnist for [[Fandango (ticket service)|Fandango]] and [[Rotten Tomatoes]].{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/feature/aboutgreg.html |title=Yahoo! Movies: About Greg's Previews |publisher=Movies.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2010}}{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/mv/upcoming/ |title=Yahoo! Movies - Greg's Previews |publisher=Movies.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2010}} *[[Gail Simone]] - author of several comic books including ''[[Birds of Prey (comic book)|Birds of Prey]]'' for DC Comics and Marvel's ''[[Deadpool]]''. ==See also== * [[Comic book death]] * [[The Hawkeye Initiative]] * [[Portrayal of women in American comics]] * ''[[The Refrigerator Monologues]]'' {{Portal bar|Comics|Death|Feminism|Gender studies|Superhero fiction}} ==References== {{Reflist|33em}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} * {{Official website|http://lby3.com/wir/}} * [http://lby3.com/wir/women.html The original 1999 ''Women in Refrigerators'' list] {{DEFAULTSORT:Women In Refrigerators}} [[Category:Websites about comics]] [[Category:Misogyny]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 1999]] [[Category:Women and comics]]

{{unreferenced|date=August 2016}} {{infobox television | | show_name = World Of Playboy | runtime = 30 mins | country = [[United States]] | network = [[Playboy TV]] | first_aired = 1999 |}} '''''World Of Playboy''''' is an adult [[infotainment]] [[newsmagazine]] currently airing on [[Playboy TV]]. It has produced over 100 episodes and functions as a monthly summary of current happenings within the [[Playboy]] brand.
==Format== Currently the longest-running program on Playboy TV, ''World of Playboy'' gives viewers various news and media updates regarding [[Hugh Hefner]], [[The Girls Next Door]], and former Playboy [[centerfold]]s. It also provides exclusive introductions to brand new [[Playboy Playmate|Playmates]] about to appear in [[Playboy magazine]].
Additionally, the show airs private footage from [[The Playboy Mansion|Playboy Mansion]] parties and company-related events.
